quizQuestions.questionText: What should a traveler do if they want to determine the qiblah direction on an airplane for obligatory prayers?

options.text: Ask the stewards about the direction of the qiblah
Wait until landing to pray the missed prayers
Use a compass they brought from home
Follow the direction the plane is heading

quizQuestions.explanation: The traveler must ask the stewards about the direction of the qiblah if the airplane does not have a sign showing it. If they do not ask, their prayer is not valid.

quizQuestions.questionText: How did the Prophet (peace be upon him) pray naafil prayers while traveling on his camel?

options.text: He prayed no matter which direction the camel was facing
He always dismounted and faced the qiblah
He only prayed when the camel was stationary
He turned the camel to face the qiblah first

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to pray naafil prayers whilst riding his camel, no matter which direction it was facing, if he was travelling. However, obligatory prayers require facing the qiblah.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the Shaafa'is and Hanbalis, what happens if you deliberately swallow saliva after it reaches your lips during fasting?

options.text: It invalidates the fast because the saliva has separated from its usual place
It does not affect the fast as saliva is part of the body
It only invalidates if the saliva is mixed with food particles
It requires making up the day but no expiation

quizQuestions.explanation: The Shaafa'is and Hanbalis view that deliberately swallowing saliva after it reaches the lips invalidates the fast, because the saliva has separated from where it usually is (inside of the mouth), so swallowing it is like swallowing anything else that is separate from the body.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling if saliva dries on the lips and then you close your lips while fasting?

options.text: There is nothing wrong with it because its traces disappear when it dries
The fast is broken and must be made up
It requires both making up the day and expiation
The person must immediately rinse their mouth

quizQuestions.explanation: If saliva dries on the lips, its traces disappear when it dries up, and there is nothing left that could cause one to break the fast at all, whether deliberately or by mistake.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, what does the Arabic word 'Quran' come from?

options.text: The word 'al-qar' which means gathering and putting things together
The word 'qara'a' which means to read aloud
The word 'qirtas' which means paper or parchment
The word 'qarÄ«n' which means companion

quizQuestions.explanation: In Arabic, the word 'Quran' comes from the word meaning al-qar, which means 'gathering' and 'putting things together.' It is so called because it is a collection of all the suwar (plural of surah).

quizQuestions.questionText: In Surah al-Baqarah verse 185, what does Allah say was revealed in the month of Ramadan?

options.text: The Quraan
The Torah
The Gospel
The Psalms

quizQuestions.explanation: Allah says in Surah al-Baqarah 2:185: 'The month of Ramadan in which was revealed the Quraan.' This is one of many verses where Allah Himself names His Book as 'Quraan.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say happens when people gather in one of the houses of Allah to recite the Book of Allah and study it together?

options.text: Tranquillity descends, angels surround them, mercy comes down, and Allah mentions them to those who are with Him
Their sins are immediately forgiven and their names are written among the righteous
They receive the reward of performing Hajj and Umrah
They are granted protection from trials for forty days

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'No group of people gathers in one of the houses of Allah to recite the Book of Allah and study it together, but tranquillity descends upon them, the angels surround them, mercy comes down upon them, and Allah mentions them to those who are with Him.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on reciting the Quran collectively in unison, all pausing and stopping at the same time?

options.text: Not prescribed in Islam and at the very least it is makrooh (disliked)
Highly recommended and brings double the reward
Obligatory for mosque gatherings after Fajr prayer
Permissible only during Ramadan nights

quizQuestions.explanation: Reciting the Quran all together in unison, pausing and stopping at the same time, is not prescribed in Islam and at the very least it is makrooh (disliked), because it is not reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) or his Companions did any such thing.

quizQuestions.questionText: What condition is mentioned regarding distributing tapes as charity during condolence gatherings?

options.text: Not believing that giving charity during the mourning period has extra virtue beyond other times
Getting permission from all the deceased's family members first
Distributing only on the third day after death
Ensuring the tapes are recitations of specific Quranic chapters

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing wrong with distributing tapes during the condolence gathering, but that is subject to the condition that you do not believe that giving charity during the days of mourning is of extra virtue, as some people think that giving charity during the mourning period is essential to help the deceased.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say when a man asked if his deceased mother would be rewarded if he gave charity on her behalf?

options.text: Yes
Only if she had made a will requesting it
Only during the first forty days after death
No, because each soul bears its own burden

quizQuestions.explanation: A man said to the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'My mother died suddenly and I think that if she could have spoken she would have given charity; will she have a reward if I give charity on her behalf?' He said: 'Yes.' This confirms that charity on behalf of the deceased reaches them.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith mentioned, what happens to the person who fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward?

options.text: His previous sins will be forgiven
He will be granted a house in Paradise
He will be protected from trials for one year
His prayers will be accepted for forty days

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.'

quizQuestions.questionText: In the hadith about the people who broke their fast before its proper time, how are they described in the punishment?

options.text: Suspended by their ankles with the corners of their mouths torn and pouring with blood
Forced to eat burning coals and drink boiling water
Chained in a dark valley unable to move
Standing on hot sand under a scorching sun

quizQuestions.explanation: Abu Umaamah reported seeing in the Prophet's dream people suspended by their ankles, with the corners of their mouths torn and pouring with blood. When asked who they were, it was said: 'These are the people who broke their fast before it was time to do so.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What does seeking the help of jinn or turning to them to fulfill one's desires constitute according to the answer?

options.text: Shirk or associating others in worship with Allah
A minor sin that requires repentance
An innovation (bid'ah) that should be avoided
A disliked action that reduces one's reward

quizQuestions.explanation: Seeking the help of the jinn or turning to them to fulfill one's desires is shirk or associating others in worship with Allah, because it is a kind of mutual benefitting whereby the jinn responds to the human's requests in return for the human's veneration.
tags: Belief in the Jinn, witchcraft and the evil eye

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say about someone who goes to a fortune-teller and believes what he said?

options.text: He has disbelieved in that which was revealed to Muhammad
His prayers will not be accepted for seventy days
He must perform expiation by fasting three days
He has committed a major sin requiring sincere repentance

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever goes to a fortuneteller and believes what he said has disbelieved in that which was revealed to Muhammad.' This shows the severity of believing fortune-tellers.
tags: Belief in the Jinn, witchcraft and the evil eye

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, what is a major problem with the fabricated hadith about the five prayers?

options.text: It was not narrated by scholars of hadith with a saheeh isnad
It contradicts the number of daily prayers prescribed
It mentions prayers that were later abrogated
It attributes the prayers to Moses instead of Muhammad

quizQuestions.explanation: One of the obvious signs that the hadith is fabricated is that it was not narrated by the scholars of hadith with a saheeh isnad. It is a well known principle that any hadith that was not narrated with a saheeh isnad is to be rejected.

quizQuestions.questionText: What does the authentic hadith say about when the gates of heaven are opened?

options.text: After the sun has passed the meridian (when Zuhr time begins)
At the time of Fajr when believers pray in congregation
During the last third of the night
Just before Maghrib when people break their fast

quizQuestions.explanation: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to pray four rak'ahs before Zuhr, after the sun had passed the meridian, and he said: 'The gates of heaven are opened and I like to send forth a good deed at this time.' This contradicts the fabricated hadith's claim about Zuhr being when Hell is stoked.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, whom is the wife obliged to obey?

options.text: Her husband
Her husband's parents
Both her husband and his parents equally
Whoever is the head of the household

quizQuestions.explanation: What the wife is obliged to do is to obey her husband; he is the one whom she is obliged to obey. If the husband agrees that she may visit her family, it does not matter if his parents do not approve.

quizQuestions.questionText: What does the Quran say in Fussilat 41:34 about repelling evil treatment?

options.text: Repel the evil with one which is better, then he who was your enemy will become as though he was a close friend
Repel evil with justice and Allah will judge between you
Repel evil by distancing yourself from those who wrong you
Repel evil by seeking the help of righteous people

quizQuestions.explanation: Allah says: 'Repel (the evil) with one which is better (i.e. Allah orders the faithful believers to be patient at the time of anger, and to excuse those who treat them badly) then verily he, between whom and you there was enmity, (will become) as though he was a close friend.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on working in a satellite TV company that broadcasts both religious channels and immoral content?

options.text: It is not permissible and is haraam earnings
It is permissible as long as you work only on the religious channels
It is disliked but not forbidden if you need the income
It is permissible if you donate part of your salary to charity

quizQuestions.explanation: Working in this company is not permissible, and it is haraam earnings, because this company facilitates channels that promote immorality, deviation and misguidance. This is helping in sin and transgression, which Allah has forbidden.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Holy Spirit (Jibreel) inspire to the Prophet regarding provision?

options.text: No soul will die until it has been given its provision in full
Provision comes only to those who strive hard in seeking it
Allah increases provision for those who give charity
Lawful provision is scarce, so be grateful for what you receive

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The Holy Spirit (i.e. Jibreel) inspired to me that no soul will die until it has been given its provision in full. Fear Allah and be moderate in seeking a living, and do not let the fact that it is slow in coming make you seek it by disobeying Allah.'
